PUBLICATION

event.title: ULD Version III

data.event:
IBM Laboratory Vienna publishes Universal Language Document version III, featuring:

- Formal Definition of the PL/I Compile Time Facilities by M. Fleck
- Concrete Syntax of PL/I by G. Urschler
- Translation of PL/I into Abstract Syntax by G. Urschler
- Abstract Syntax and Interpretation of PL/I by Kurt Walk, K. Alber, M. Fleck, H. Goldmann, Peter E. Lauer, E. Moser, P. Oliva, H. Stigleitner and G. Zeise
- Informal Introduction to the Abstract Syntax and Interpretation of PL/I by K. Alber, H. Goldmann, Peter E. Lauer, Peter Lucas, P. Oliva, H. Stigleitner, Kurt Walk and G. Zeisel

PUBLICATION

event.title: ULD Version II

data.event:
IBM Laboratory Vienna publishes Universal Language Document version II, featuring:

- Concrete Syntax of PL/I by K. Alber, P. Oliva and G. Urschler
- Formal Definition of the PL/I Compile Time Facilities by M. Fleck and Erich Neuhold
- Informal Introduction to the Abstract Syntax and Interpretation of PL/I by Peter Lucas, K. Alber, Kurt Bandat, Hans Bekič, P. Oliva, Kurt Walk and G. Zeise
- Method and Notation for the Formal Definition of Programming Languages by Peter Lucas, Peter E. Lauer and H. Stigleitner
- Abstract Syntax and Interpretation of PL/I by Kurt Walk, K. Alber, K. Bandat, Hans Bekič, Gerhard Chroust, Viktor Kudielka, P. Oliva and G. Zeisel
- Translation of PL/I into Abstract Syntax by K. Alber and P. Oliva

Available here.

PUBLICATION

Final release of Brian Wichmann's reproducation of The ALGOL Bulletin.

Available here.

WEBSITE, PUBLICATION

event.title: Pascal

data.event:
Publication of Derek Andrews and Wolfgang Henhapl's 'Pascal' in Formal Specification and Software Development, edited by Dines Bjørner and Cliff B. Jones.

Available here.

PAPER, PUBLICATION

event.title: The Formal Definition of Modula-2

data.event:
Publication of D.J. Andrews, A. Garg, S.P.A. Lau and J.R. Pitchers' 'The formal definition of Modula-2 and its associated interpreter' in VDM '88 VDM - The Way Ahead.

PAPER, PUBLICATION

event.title: A Formal Definition of ALGOL 60

data.event:
C. D. Allen, D. N. Chapman and Cliff B. Jones publish A Formal Definition of ALGOL 60.

Available here.

REPORT, PUBLICATION

event.title: Operational and Denotational Semantics of Prolog

data.event:
Publication of Bijan Arbab and Daniel M Berry's 'Operational and denotational semantics of prolog' in The Journal of Logic Programming 4.4.

OPERATIONAL, DENOTATIONAL, PAPER, PUBLICATION

event.title: Semantics and Proof Theory of PASCAL Procedures

data.event:
Publication of Krzysztof R Apt and Jacobus Willem de Bakker's 'Semantics and proof theory of PASCAL procedures' in International Colloquium on Automata, Languages and Programming.

PAPER, PUBLICATION

event.title: An Axiomatic Basis for Computer Programming

data.event:
Publication of Tony Hoare's 'An axiomatic basis for comptuter programming' in Communications of the ACM 12.10.

Available here.

AXIOMATIC, PAPER, PUBLICATIONS

event.title: FLDL conference

data.event:
Formal Language Description Languages conference, Baden-bei-Wien.

CONFERENCE

event.title: FLDL proceedings

data.event:
Proceedings of FLDL conference, edited by T. B. Steel, are published by North Holland.

CONFERENCE, PROCEEDINGS, PUBLICATION

event.title: Mimeograph of 'Assigning Meaning'

data.event:
Bob Floyd circulates a mimeographed version of 'Assigning Meanings to Programs.' Available on Cliff's webpage at this page.

DRAFT, AXIOMATIC, PUBLICATIONS

event.title: 'Assigning Meaning'

data.event:
Publication of Bob Floyd's 'Assigning meaning to programs' in Mathematical Aspects of Computer Science.

PAPER, AXIOMATIC, PUBLICATION

event.title: Jones in Vienna 1

data.event:
Cliff Jones spends his first soujourn at the IBM Laboratory in Vienna

VIENNA, LOCATION

event.title: Jones in Vienna 2

data.event:
Cliff Jones' second secondment in Vienna.

VIENNA, LOCATION

event.title: Scott in Vienna

data.event:
Invited by the Vienna group to help explain Floyd's 'Assigning meanings', Dana Scott visits.

VIENNA, LOCATION

event.title: WG 2.2 meeting Vienna

data.event:
At a WG 2.2 (remit: semantics!) meeting in Vienna, Dana Scott and Christopher Strachey meet, presumably locking eyes across the room or something like that.

CONFERENCE, OXFORD, DENOTATIONAL

event.title: Jones in Stanford

data.event:
Cliff Jones visits Stanford, probably to meet McCarthy.

LOCATION

event.title: Jones visits Floyd

data.event:
Cliff Jones takes a trip to the as-yet unMellonized Carnegie Tech and meets Bob Floyd.

LOCATION

event.title: MTOC at YTH

data.event:
Mathematical Theory of Computation conference at IBM Research Yorktown Heights Laboratory (in NY state). The famous snow-chain occurrence.

LOCATION?

event.title: Jones VDL course

data.event:
Cliff Jones attends a course on VDL in Vienna.

VIENNA, OPERATIONAL, LOCATION

event.title: Scott in Oxford

data.event:
Dana Scott spends a tumultuous term in Oxford working feverishly with Christopher Strachey. The majority of denotational semantics is hashed out during this time.

OXFORD, DENOTATIONAL

event.title: Jones in Oxford

data.event:
Cliff Jones travels to Oxford to hear Christopher Strachey lecture (among other dates in this period).

OXFORD, DENOTATIONAL

event.title: Essex meeting

data.event:
John Laski 'invites' Peter Lucas, Kurt Walk, Peter Lauer, and Cliff Jones to Essex. Needs a firmer time. John C. Reynolds and Peter J. Landin may also have been present there.

VIENNA, OPERATIONAL

event.title: Sufrin joins Oxford

data.event:
Bernard Sufrin starts working at Oxford.

OXFORD

event.title: Christopher Strachey dies

data.event:
Infectious hepatitis kills Christopher Strachey, probably aggravated by the stress of writing the Adams Essay.

OXFORD

event.title: Christopher Strachey born

data.event: OXFORD

event.title: ETH talk

data.event:
Niklaus Wirth invites Cliff to ETH to give a talk. Subject as yet undetermined.

LOCATION, LECTURE

event.title: Bekic visits Landin

data.event:
Hans Bekič, spending a year in QMC visiting Peter Landin, gives a fortnightly seminar on The Description of Programming Languages, starting on this date.

LOCATION, VIENNA, LECTURE
